meanings.definition: A vertical structure typically consisting of a cylindrical shaft with a capital and base.
meanings.sent1: The ancient building had tall columns supporting its roof.
meanings.sent2: The marble columns outside the museum were impressive.
meanings.sent3: When the columns started dancing, the audience was amazed.
meanings.sent4: The columns of trees in the forest stood like guardians of nature.
meanings.sent5: The columns of the bridge stretched towards the sky like giant fingers.

meanings.definition: A regular feature or section in a newspaper or magazine.
meanings.sent1: The sports column in the newspaper always had the latest scores.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading the advice columns in the magazine.
meanings.sent3: The gossip columns in the tabloid were full of juicy stories.
meanings.sent4: The opinion column in the paper sparked a heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The fashion column showcased the latest trends in clothing.

meanings.definition: A vertical arrangement of numbers or text in a table or list.
meanings.sent1: The spreadsheet had columns for expenses and income.
meanings.sent2: The phone directory listed names alphabetically in columns.
meanings.sent3: The columns of numbers seemed to be having a party on the page.
meanings.sent4: The columns of data stood like soldiers ready for analysis.
meanings.sent5: The columns of figures made it easy to compare the information.
